result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Hickman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Landmark Credit Union to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.

No Contact with Gregory M. and ACS in New Berlin. Probation may terminate early after one year. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Scott A Hickman in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso advises this matter has a an agreement but the parties are waiting on an amended information.  Case will be recalled.  Case recalled at 9:07 am.  Amended information filed. Defendant pleads guilty to amended counts 1,2, and 3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1,2, and 3.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Concurrent.  
Term of Probation: 18 months, May have early termination after 1year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Gregory M. and ACS New Berlin.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Restitution: $542.94 to be paid to Landmark Credit Union as a condition of probation. 
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
